channel.title: Comments on: Speed of sound lab, 21st century version
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/16/speed-of-sound-lab-21st-century-version/#comment-204">Jordan J</a>.
Hi Jordan,
I did this with Geogebra, but I've been more hooked on using <a href="http://www.desmos.com/calculator" rel="nofollow ugc">Desmos</a> these days for all my graphing needs. Lots of tutorials over there on how to do this. Let me know if you need any more insight into getting that done.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jordan J.

Hi Jordan,

I did this with Geogebra, but I’ve been more hooked on using Desmos these days for all my graphing needs. Lots of tutorials over there on how to do this. Let me know if you need any more insight into getting that done.

item.title: By: Jordan J
item.dc:creator: Jordan J
item.description: Hey Mr. Weinberg, I was wondering how you were able to create that graph. I have to create a similar graph for my physics report, so your help would be greatly appreciated!
item.content:encoded:
Hey Mr. Weinberg,
I was wondering how you were able to create that graph. I have to create a similar graph for my physics report, so your help would be greatly appreciated!

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/16/speed-of-sound-lab-21st-century-version/#comment-202">Paul Miller</a>.
Awesome - I'd love to hear how it goes. Keep me posted!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Paul Miller.

Awesome – I’d love to hear how it goes. Keep me posted!

item.title: By: Paul Miller
item.dc:creator: Paul Miller
item.description: I'm going to try to incorporate a little of this into conceptual physics here at WVU. This is a great idea and the students already play with "Audacity" during the speed of sound lab.
item.content:encoded: I’m going to try to incorporate a little of this into conceptual physics here at WVU. This is a great idea and the students already play with “Audacity” during the speed of sound lab.

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/16/speed-of-sound-lab-21st-century-version/#comment-200">Bob W</a>.
Thanks Dad!

item.title: By: Bob W
item.dc:creator: Bob W
item.description: Check out this app for ipad or iphone. Great signal generator and more useful in your physics labs http://studiosixdigital.com/audiotools/
item.content:encoded: Check out this app for ipad or iphone. Great signal generator and more useful in your physics labs http://studiosixdigital.com/audiotools/
